More information!

Transportation & Parking:

Since the reception is at our home, we will not be able to accommodate guests parking their cars. Please try to use one of the transportation options listed below:
  • The Green Line T: We are located on the Green (B-Boston College) Line just a one-minute walk from the BU-West stop.
  • The MBTA Bus: We are located about a three-minute walk from Mountford St @ Carlton St bus station, which serves busses CT2 and 47. We are also three minutes from Commonwealth Ave @ Buick St, serving bus 57.
  • Uber / Lyft / Rideshare apps: Just enter in our address, we are right across from the BU Bridge!

Boston Accommodation:

If you are coming from out of town, we recommend that you book your accommodations as soon as you can, as Boston can get a little pricey,
Below are some tips and recommendations for accommodation:
  • For the cheapest option, if you know someone in the area, try and stay with them!
  • Try renting on AirBnB. This is probably the best option for bigger groups who want to bunk up together. Anywhere in brookline, cambridge, beacon hill, back bay, south end, north end, allston, or even somerville area should be totally fine and accessible via public transportation (if you have questions about the location of the airbnb before booking, feel free to call Anneli).
  • Hotels can get pretty expensive, especially in Boston. However, here are some we recommend, and sometimes you can get good deals on a third-party booking site like hotels.com: [TBD - Insert Names and Links Here; Le Meridien; ...]
  • Bed & Breakfasts: If you want more of the historical-homey-victorian feel, then you may want to look at these two, adorable B&Bs: The Mary Prentiss Inn; The Bertram Inn.
If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us at annelihersh@gmail.com or (216)-214-4165.
Thank you and we hope to celebrate this special day with you!
